subject: Philosophy
title: The Gettier Problem
description: A quick, practical guide to The Gettier Problem.

hook.text: A man checks a broken clock. It reads 3:15 â€” and it actually is 3:15. Does he know the time?

buildup.text: He believes it, he's justified by reading a clock, and he's right. That fits Plato's definition.

discovery.text: Edmund Gettier showed that justified true belief can happen by sheer luck.

twist.text: His three-page paper in 1963 demolished a definition that had stood since Plato.

climax.text: Dozens of fixes have been proposed. No single replacement has won universal acceptance.

punchline.text: Being right for the wrong reason isn't knowledge.

quiz.question: What did Gettier's famous paper challenge?
